page.title: 03SSSI's and the Levels
page.content: Wet Moor, Rotten Ham, Fore Moor, Ablake, Muchelney Level, Whit Moor, East Moor, Wet Crouds, With Moor, Rod Moor and Out Moor are to be designated sites of special scientific interest in 1985. This will assist the overwintering of the visiting whooper swans and also maintain the habitats of other less conspicuous flora and fauna. Each winter the waters of the Yeo flood over the banks onto thousands of acres, to a depth of several feet. The visiting birds fly in at dusk, announcing their arrival with echoing voice and wing-song. In future there will be no land drainage, no general weedkillers, no ploughing, no horse grazing and no silage making. Cattle will be grazed within specific dates, and haymaking will not take place before June 16th. Compensation will be paid to affected farmers.
